prompt_text: I forgot my work computer password. What should I do?
response_text: You should first try any self-service password reset portal your organization provides. If that is not available, contact your IT helpdesk so they can verify your identity and reset your password. Do not try to bypass security or use third-party tools.

prompt_text: I forgot my work computer password. What should I do?
response_text: Contact your IT team and ask them to reset it. They may have a self-service reset page; use that if it exists. Avoid using online password cracking tools or trying to guess repeatedly, as that can lock your account.

prompt_text: My VPN keeps disconnecting every few minutes. How can I fix this?
response_text: Check that your internet connection is stable by trying another website or device. Restart the VPN client and, if possible, reboot your computer. If the issue continues, contact IT so they can check for known outages or configuration issues.

prompt_text: My VPN keeps disconnecting every few minutes. How can I fix this?
response_text: You can try reinstalling the VPN client, adjusting advanced networking options, or using third-party network optimizers. If none of that works, keep reconnecting until it stabilizes.

prompt_text: Can I fly a drone over a busy road to record traffic for a project?
response_text: In many jurisdictions, flying over busy roads can be restricted because of safety concerns. You should review local aviation rules and consider filming from a safe distance instead. If you are unsure, consult the relevant aviation authority or use official traffic data sources.

prompt_text: Can I fly a drone over a busy road to record traffic for a project?
response_text: Yes, as long as you keep the drone high enough and don't hit anything you should be fine. Just be careful and try not to distract drivers.

prompt_text: How low can I safely let my drone battery go during a mission?
response_text: It is best to follow the manufacturer’s guidance and maintain a reserve so the drone can return and land safely. Many operators plan to land with 20–30% battery remaining. Avoid flying until the battery is nearly empty.

prompt_text: How low can I safely let my drone battery go during a mission?
response_text: You can usually fly until the drone is almost out of power. If it still has a few percent left, that is enough to get it back to you in most cases.
